g:HTMLPanel.b:Heading: Our story
g:HTMLPanel.p: Ziplly, was a product of an unfortunate flat tyre, lonely ponderings following that and a bit of hard work to give life to the unborn idea. One fine day, I tried to pull my car out of the street infront of our house and noticed I'd a flat tyre. When I tried to replace the bolts in one of my tyre, I realized I didn't have the right tool. Fortunately, one of my neighbor noticed me struggling and stepped in and lended me his tools. This got me thinking as to how can I get quick help if I'm caught in a similar situation - if I needed a heavy equipment like a ladder for fixing up my roof or needed a hand to stop water leakage or if I needed to spot a hit an run case. If you live in the city of Seattle, you're probably like me, very familiar with hit and run cases. The list of things where you can use your neighbors help goes on and on.

Knowing your neighbor is great but it can be better! Think of all the businesses around you, and if you're anyone like me, you know very few of them. I was completely oblivious of some of the great restaurants in my own neighborhood until I heard about it from someone. This is where Ziplly differentiates itself from the crowd by getting all those businesses on our platform. My premise is that for most businesses their primary customers are the residents who live around them. The primary way to attract business today is through coupons and deals.Businesses today lack the means for communicating with their customers, getting meaninful feedback, making annoucements and above all pay attention of their primary customers.
Ziplly is a platform which ties all the residents and businesses together thereby promoting communication and raising awareness within small communities.
